channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023100906
item.description:
Report X-2023100906

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Hazmat package was damaged during inbound sort. The outer layer of the package was found wet with white paint. QA was called and proper handling was done to get the package over to the Hazmat cage to be processed. Two of the cans of paint were leaking potentially because of a dent on the side of the cans. DescribePack: The lids on the cans of paint were a bit open. which was caused by a dent found on the cans. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The release of the contents was contained by the package box until it made it to inspection.

DescribePack: The package dropped onto its side causing the cap of the canister to shake loose and release a little bit of liquid. item.title: Report X-2023100844
item.description:
Report X-2023100844

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration one hour. DescribePack: Package was punctured contents spilles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken by QA. It was put inside a lined hazmat tote and processed accordingly.

item.title: Report X-2023100721
item.description:
Report X-2023100721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release at the OAKH facility. The fiberboard box contained four 1 gallon plastic containers separated with fiberboard dividers. The caps on two pf the plastic containers had come off causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.description:

  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100691 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND RIPPED/TORN OPEN. ONE OF THE CONTENTS CAP IS CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. CONTETNS ARE REGULATED AND PKG IS UNDECLARED. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTENTS CAP IS CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. 2. X-2023100694 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.

SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: ALL CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREAD WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODED AWAY. TWO OF THE CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEALS UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. item.title: Report X-2023100682
item.description:
Report X-2023100682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100682 SequenceEvent: Package was torn on one side, and around that tear, discoloration is significantly obvious. Inside were 4 quantities of 1 qt Steris Spor-Klenz Concentrate, each inside a plastic bag. Inside that plastic bag, liquid can be seen out of the bottle evident of a leakage on all them DescribePack: Cap is loose about a quarter of a turn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from the trailer, placed in a plastic lined container and wiped down any spills. 2. X-2023100912 SequenceEvent: Shipment exterior packaging was wet on one corner on its underside and removed from the sort stream. It was put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a finger loose cap on it. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent materials, while the rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container.

item.title: Report X-2023100662
item.description:
Report X-2023100662

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed hazmat package was leaking and informed direct manager right away. Manager placed leaky hazmat inside a hazmat tote with absorbent, and used absorbent to clean up spill on floor. QA was then called to collect the item safely. DescribePack: The top cap's plastic seal broke on the bottle and caused cap to come loose and leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaky hazmat package was placed inside a hazmat tote with absorbent to stop source of leak, and absorbent was used to clean up spill on floor.

item.description:
Report X-2023100656

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on top of the sorter with an internal leakage and ripped open with 1 of 4 bottles missing. The leakage also damaged another Non-Hazardous package. DescribePack: The package was improperly unloaded sent up the sorter. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed into a hazmat bag and taken to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100654
item.description:
Report X-2023100654

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer door opened in unload and once opened, metal pail fell out causing spill. DescribePack: Metal cap seemed to have opened from under its frame. closures look to be pressured and when pail fell the pressure caused it to open slightly causing spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lifted Pail on its upside and put in a hazmat tote to mitigate release

item.title: Report X-2023100649
item.description:
Report X-2023100649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: STOCKTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in the unload and found wet on all sides. DescribePack: Package was wet and leaking liquid from the lid small amount. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote lined with a hazardous materials bag and then taken to the HMPA for further investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023100369
item.description:
Report X-2023100369

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: COSTA MESA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 10/04/2023 at approximatelty 1207, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475551 at the station location in Costa Mesa, reporting a non-hazardous spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a Throttle Body air intake cleaner at 12 ounces, Prestone power steering fluid at 32 ounces, Purple power cleaner and degreaser trigger spray at 40 ounces, and Purple Power cleaner and degreaser liquid at 1 gallon, which leaked partially. Further investigation revealed that the Throttle Body air intake cleaner is an aerosol container that was being shipped under the Limited quantiy exception under FedEx Extra Hours program. The shipment is being held for further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report X-2023100696
item.description:
Report X-2023100696

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Inbound sort the package was damaged while loading into a can. QA was called to pick up the mess and clean up any spill corresponding to the contents. All clean up materials and package contents were brought to the hazmat cage to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: While the package was being loaded the lid on the cans of paint came loose letting the paint inside get onto the floor. The lid came loose due to an over look on package handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly placed upright and the spillage was quickly cleaned, than relocated to bin in the hazmat area to be processed
